intro: Hordeum temirense, commonly known as the Temir Peninsula barley, is a wild grass species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous颖果. The plant typically grows in rocky or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are narrow and have a rough texture, while its seeds are small and hardy, contributing to its survival in challenging habitats. Hordeum temirense holds ecological significance as a part of the local flora and may serve as a genetic resource for agricultural research.
